author: Ada Seedorf Callahan
content:
Day 7 on carnivore and I have felt completely fine until today! Everything is going straight through me 🫣.  For those who experienced this, how long did it take your body to acclimate? What did you do to ease the “liquid release”🙄? I feel maybe my body is in shock as I was a high fiber eater before swapping to NO fiber. I just need reassurances that this won’t last! Because I feel horrible right now.  And I have never had any gallbladder or pancreatic issues…but I know my body is probably in a state of confusion with the drastic change 🫤

Timing depends on a lot of variables. I eased into carnivore, suffered constipation followed by a bout with hemorrhoids which only lasted 2 days .... Eating fat is required to transition... You'll be so glad you stayed with it ... Know that it WILL get better soon.

No such experience at all. These problems occur with me because of coffee, magnesium or too much fat. Not because of the meat or cheese or eggs
I’m still battling well over a month of sudden, explosive diarrhea. I’ve tried changing several things, but nothing seems to work. I’m not giving up though. My weight loss stalled after 16 lbs.
I’m on day 24 and just starting to really feel better but there are still some episodes 🤣 I know I’ll feel better in the end though so I am just pushing through!

The melted butter can be a problem with this the first month or so. They say to eat it cold to help
Alleviate your symptoms.
